     249             :   enum DeferredFinalizeType {

     251             :     FinalizeNow,
     252             :   };
     253             : 
     254             :   void FinalizeDeferredThings(DeferredFinalizeType aType);
     255             : 
     256             :   // Two conditions, JSOutOfMemory and JSLargeAllocationFailure, are noted in
     257             :   // crash reports. Here are the values that can appear in the reports:
     258             :   enum class OOMState : uint32_t {
     259             :     // The condition has never happened. No entry appears in the crash report.
     260             :     OK,
     261             : 
     262             :     // We are currently reporting the given condition.
     263             :     //
     264             :     // Suppose a crash report contains "JSLargeAllocationFailure:
     265             :     // Reporting". This means we crashed while executing memory-pressure
     266             :     // observers, trying to shake loose some memory. The large allocation in
     267             :     // question did not return null: it is still on the stack. Had we not
     268             :     // crashed, it would have been retried.
     269             :     Reporting,
     270             : 
     271             :     // The condition has been reported since the last GC.
     272             :     //
     273             :     // If a crash report contains "JSOutOfMemory: Reported", that means a small
     274             :     // allocation failed, and then we crashed, probably due to buggy
     275             :     // error-handling code that ran after allocation returned null.
     276             :     //
     277             :     // This contrasts with "Reporting" which means that no error-handling code
     278             :     // had executed yet.
     279             :     Reported,
     280             : 
     281             :     // The condition has happened, but a GC cycle ended since then.
     282             :     //
     283             :     // GC is taken as a proxy for "we've been banging on the heap a good bit
     284             :     // now and haven't crashed; the OOM was probably handled correctly".
     285             :     Recovered
     286             :   };
     287             : 
     288             :   void SetLargeAllocationFailure(OOMState aNewState);
     289             : 
     290             : private:
     291             :   void AnnotateAndSetOutOfMemory(OOMState* aStatePtr, OOMState aNewState);
     292             :   void OnGC(JSGCStatus aStatus);
     293             :   void OnOutOfMemory();
